p: Curcuma longa ( C. longa), usually known as turmeric, has been used for thousands of years in the Ayurvedic tradition as well as for culinary purpose. The plant, which belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, is a perennial herb known as “ kunyit” in Malaysia. In folk medicine, C. longa is frequently used for the management of asthma, gonorrhea, helminthic diseases, and urinary tract disorders [ 109]. Rhizome of C. longa is known to possess several therapeutic properties such as anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, antibacterial, antiviral, antifungal, and antidiabetic properties [ 110– 114].
